share on x lg lynn garvie. jun 21 at 8:43 pm i met jerry when i worked at spartan motors. he picked up the motor home chassis. i loaded them on his truck he always had a great sense of humor always had a smile on his face. he was a great guy over all and he will be sorely missed. rip jerry you were one of the great ones!!! comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x nissae converse. jun 21 at 7:19 pm as much as it hurt to say goodbye there is comfort in knowing you are in such a better place. we all love and miss you so much, take care of mom. <3. comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x nissae converse. jun 21 at 7:17 pm 8 files added to the album grandpa <3 comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x kurt crandell. jun 21 at 9:28 am 1 file added to the album new album name comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x kurt crandell. jun 21 at 9:14 am 1 file added to the album new album name comment share comment share facebook twitter share on x more memories... graveside service. jun 27. 11:00 am maple hill cemetery801 tully brown rd. charlotte, mi, us, 48813. get order flowers now for jerry's graveside service grandpa <3 new album name new album name wall 365 days of grief support. subscribe facebook pray funeral home website designed by funeralone contact obituaries about store 
get order flowers now for jerry's graveside service show less view & service share facebook twitter google+ post now light a candle virtual gifts yellow rose periwinkle blue green red dove angel heart hug butterfly roses hands in prayer bible sunshine teddy american flag veteran rosary gardener interlocked rings catholic cross football baseball golf sailboat firefighter non catholic cross basketball police buddha hockey coach soccer star of david canadian flag menorah memories events media share a memory of jerry lee crandell send comfort to the crandell family when it's needed most. to show you care same-day hand delivery by a local florist! cs cheryl l. smith. jun 22 at 8:12 am where to start on this one! jerry crandell was a man who made everyone feel like family. he became one of my "dad's 40 years ago. he opened his home to all of the "girls" he had "inherited" through his marriage to pat. by the time i had met him, we were all "teenage girls" ugh right! he just went with the flow! including the sleepovers almost every weekend, every winter, we purposely got snowed in at kimmy's house! we would literally spend days on the "sleds" i always thought they were "snowmobiles boy did i learn! everyone has memories from their childhood. the crandell house on packard, with every brother & sister, will forever be imbedded into mine! they are some of the happiest memories i have! jerry will be missed in oh so many, many ways, but he will never be far from our wonderful memories! to my whole "other" family god bless you all, love, cheryl williams smith. comment share comment share facebook twitter
